description: Add Only Flag.  Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

Advanced_Ship_NoticeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Advanced_Ship_NoticeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Advanced_Ship_NoticeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to an existing Advanced Ship Notice.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

description: Business Process Parameters provide the ability to auto-submit to the business process.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Data_Inbound.description: Advanced Ship Notice Reference ID.  This is optional and will be auto-generated if left blank on the Web Service request.
Boolean flag to indicate whether the Advanced Ship Notice should be submitted to the business process.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Data_Inbound.description: References how the how Advance Ship Notice document got created. Possible values for the reference id (Source_Name) are 'Web Service' , 'EDI', 'Manual'  .

Unique_IdentifierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Data_Inbound.description: Ship-To Address for Advance Ship Notice. If value is not provided defaults to Ship-To Address of Purchase Order.
User can provide Global Location Number here; the Location assigned to it will be used to populate the Ship-to Address
User can provide EDI Customer Account Number here; the Location assigned to it will be used to populate the Ship-to Address

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Line_Data_Inbound.description: Advanced Ship Notice Line Reference ID. This is optional and will be auto-generated if left blank.
Shipped Quantity on Advanced Ship Notice Line.

Unit_of_MeasureObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Unit_of_MeasureObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Unit_of_MeasureObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Line_Data_Inbound.description: Reference of the Unit Of Measure for the Shipped Quantity.  If value is not provided, it defaults to Unit of Measure from the corresponding Purchase Order line.
The unit cost of the item specified in the currency associated to the Purchase Order currency. If value is not provided, defaults to unit cost of corresponding line in Purchase Order.

Positive numeric value used to calculate the Ordered Quantity that is shipped from Shipped Quantity provided at Advance Shipment Line. If Shipped Quantity is five and Conversion Factor is two , then Quantity shipped is calculated as Ten. Default value for Conversion Factor is one.

LocationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Line_Data_Inbound.description: The location where the items will be delivered.
User can provide Global Location Number here; the Location assigned to it will be used to populate the Deliver-to Location
User can provide EDI Customer Account Number here; the Location assigned to it will be used to populate the Deliver-To Location

Line_Alternate_Item_Attribute_Value_Data.description: Reference to existing  Manufacturer associated with the Item Identifier Type

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Line_Data_Inbound.description: Alternate Item Identifiers for Item on Advance Ship Notice Line

validation.validation: Enter a 14 digit numeric value for GTIN Alternate Item Identifier.
Only alphanumeric values are allowed for UPN.
Value needs to be provided for Manufacturer.
Value needs to be provided for [ExternalName].
Enter a valid GTIN
Manufacturer Reference not allowed for [ExternalName]
Can't enter duplicate External Name if Allow Multiples flag is not enabled for Item Identifier mapped to [ExternalName].
Invalid value for External Name [ET].
Alternate Item Identifier, [type] has to be less than or equal to [length] characters in length.

ASN_Line_Lot_Information_Data_Inbound.description: Free form text field for Item Lot Identifier
Manufacturer Date for the Item Lot
Expiration Date for the Item Lot
Free form text for Item Lot Memo

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Line_Data_Inbound.description: Element that contains Lot Information for Item on Advance Ship Notice Line

validation.validation: Quantity cannot be negative
The count of serial numbers entered does not match the quantity.
The Lot ID is required for lot-controlled items.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Data_Inbound.description: Element that captures Advanced Ship Notice Line information. An Advanced Ship Notice can have one or more Advanced Ship Notice Lines

validation.validation: Goods line [line] does not belong to Purchase Order [po].
Goods Line [line] is fully shipped.
Lot Identifier cannot be referenced more than once for a given Advanced Ship Notice Line.
Total Lot Quantity should match the Advance Ship Notice Line Shipped Quantity.
Shipped Unit Cost cannot be negative
Conversion Factor has to be greater than zero.
Goods Line [line] is fully received.
Purchase Order Line has negative unit cost.
The Deliver-To Location is invalid for the selected Delivery Type and/or Company.
Can't receive an advanced ship notice against a purchase order line that's Closed for Receiving
Purchase Order Line Number [po line number] is closed and can't be used.
Shipped Quantity is Required
Quantity cannot be negative

Financials_Attachment_Data.description: Text attribute identifying Content Type of the Attachment.
Text attribute identifying Filename of the Attachment.
Text attribute identifying Encoding of the Attachment.
Boolean attribute identifying whether the Attachment is compressed.

Advanced_Ship_Notice_Data_Inbound.description: Encapsulating element containing all Business Document Attachment data.

validation.validation: If a file name is specified for a Financial Attachment, File Content and Content Type are required.
A Purchase Order Goods line is required on Advanced Ship Notice.
Purchase order goods line cannot be referenced more than once in a Advanced Ship Notice.
Purchase Order is not in Issued status.
You can't submit an advanced ship notice when there's a condition rule to block this action.
